Title: AI Entwickler (m/w/d)
Description:
Bist du bereit, die technologische Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten und deine Expertise einzubringen?

Hier übernimmst du eine Schlüsselrolle, in der du maßgeblich zum Erfolg des Unternehmens beiträgst. Du bist nicht nur Entwickler*in, sondern auch Visionär*in und Team-Player*in. Wenn du eine Passion für Technologie hast, strategisch denkst und Lust hast, ein Produkt von Grund auf mitzugestalten, dann haben wir die passende Stelle für dich bei unseren Partner mit Sitz in München und Berlin. Es handelt sich dabei um ein innovatives Beratungs- und Trainingsunternehmen, das sich auf die Einführung und Umsetzung von generativer KI in Unternehmen spezialisiert hat.




Was du erwarten darfst




Eine unbefristete Festanstellung in Vollzeit
Dich erwartet ein großer Gestaltungsspielraum mit freier Hand bei der Umsetzung eigener Ideen in einem dynamischen Umfeld und mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen
Du arbeitest in einem dynamischen Startup-Flair, in dem deine Expertise direkten Einfluss auf den Unternehmenserfolg hat – in einem kreativen und motivierten Team
Flexible Arbeitsbedingungen sind gegeben, inklusive der Möglichkeit zum Remote-Arbeiten (Hybrid)
Es gibt vielfältige Möglichkeiten zur fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung in einem zukunftsorientierten Bereich







Deine Aufgaben




Du verfügst über tiefgehende Erfahrung in der Microsoft-Umgebung und bringst fundierte Kenntnisse mit Copilot Studio, Azure Open AI sowie Power Automate mit
Du entwickelst schnell und hands-on innovative Prototypen, wobei du deine Expertise im Bereich Machine Learning sowie in Programmiersprachen wie Python einbringst
Wenn erforderlich, unterstützt du als technischer Trainer – von Entwickler zu Entwickler – und führst Trainings oder Workshops durch, Erfahrungen in diesem Bereich sind wünschenswert
Du platzierst aktiv Lösungen beim Kunden, wirst in Projekte eingebunden und entwickelst interne Produkte mit. Dabei scheust du dich nicht, in kritischen Situationen dort mit anzupacken, wo Unterstützung gebraucht wird, zum Beispiel bei Entwickler-AI Trainings







Dein Profil

Du hast tiefgehende Erfahrung in der Microsoft-Umgebung, inklusive Erfahrungen mit Copilot Studio, Azure Open AI und Power Automate
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen sind für dich selbstverständlich, wobei Python essenziell ist. Erfahrungen mit weiteren Sprachen wie C# im Microsoft-Umfeld und der Umgang mit Machine Learning Frameworks, zum Beispiel TensorFlow oder PyTorch, sind von Vorteil
Die Fähigkeit, schnell und hands-on Prototypen zu entwickeln, zeichnet dich aus
Erfahrung als technischer Trainer oder in der Durchführung von Entwickler-Trainings und Workshops ist wünschenswert
Die Bereitschaft, aktiv beim Kunden Lösungen zu platzieren und in Projekten mitzuwirken, bringst du mit
Eine ausgeprägte Hands-On-Mentalität und Teamgeist sind für dich selbstverständlich
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Berlin (All Genders)
Description:
Digitl ist ein Unternehmen aus dem Bereich Marketing und Cloud-Technologie. Du hast die Chance, ein junges Unternehmen mit aufzubauen. Wir sind praxisnahe Spezialisten, die es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht haben, das Thema Service im digitalen Marketing noch innovativer anzugehen. Neue Ideen und frische Ansätze sind bei uns immer willkommen. Bei Digitl hast du nicht nur die Chance auf eine Karriere mit Gründergeist, du arbeitest auch mit spannenden Kunden zusammen und stehst in engem Kontakt mit unseren Ansprechpartnern bei Google.


Tasks



Du entwickelst und leitest innovative Data Science- und Machine Learning-Projekte im digitalen Marketing, insbesondere Marketing Mix Modelings und prädiktive Modelle


Als Teil des Consultings bist Du von Anfang bis Ende in verschiedene Projekte und Kunden involviert und ergänzt das Team und unsere Kunden für bestmögliche Ergebnisse


Deine Rolle ist sehr vielfältig und reicht vom Projektmanagement über jeden Schritt des CRISP-DM-Zyklus, vom Geschäftsverständnis über die Datenextraktion und Modellierung bis hin zur Bereitstellung und Überwachung.


Du arbeitest interdisziplinär mit unseren Cloud-, Digital Analytics- und Ad Technology-Teams zusammen, um bestehende Lösungen zu verbessern und neue zu entwickeln.


Du bist über die neuesten Trends und Entwicklungen informiert und liebst es Dein Wissen weiterzugeben.





.


Qualifications



Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (z. B. Data Science, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik)


Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science und/oder maschinelles Lernen - mit Schwerpunkt auf digitalem Marketing und Marketing Mix Modeling oder prädiktiven Modellen


Statistik- und Machine-Learning-Kenntnisse, insbesondere Bayes'sche Regression und Klassifikation


Kenntnisse in SQL, Python und führenden Data-Science-Tools (z. B. Jupyter Notebooks, GitHub)


Erfahrung mit Google Marketing Platform Tools und Daten (z. B. Google Analytics, Google Ads) und Visualisierungstools (z. B. Looker Studio) ist ein Plus


Erfahrung in der Beratung von Kunden; Erklären und Präsentieren komplexer Inhalte auf einfache und sichere Art und Weise


Erfahrung im Projektmanagement


Klare Kommunikation in Wort und Schrift - in fließendem Deutsch und Englisch


Teamfähigkeit



Perks & Benefits



Co-Working: Dir steht ein Platz in den besten Co-Working Spaces in Düsseldorf, Zürich, Barcelona oder Hamburg zur Verfügung.


Remote 1st: Alle unsere Prozesse sind auf dezentrales Arbeiten ausgelegt. Du entscheidest, ob du lieber vom Home Office aus arbeitest oder deinen Tag in einem unserer Büros verbringst.


Home-Office-Ausstattung: Wir stellen dir eine hochwertige Standardausstattung für deine Remote-Arbeitsumgebung zur Verfügung.


Tierliebhaber: Wenn du einen Hund hast, bring ihn mit zur Arbeit.


Kompetenzerweiterung: Als hochspezialisierter Technologiepartner unterstützen wir deine Entwicklung mit Zertifizierungen, Konferenzbesuchen und Schulungsmöglichkeiten.
Show more

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Your mission

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Cloover, you’ll play a pivotal role in supporting teams across the company—including finance, sales, and marketing—by providing actionable data insights and helping us achieve our climate goals. Your responsibilities include:


Supporting the design, testing, and refinement of credit risk models and portfolio analytics that drive renewable energy financing.
Analyzing and optimizing large datasets stored in Google BigQuery to uncover trends and enable data-driven decision-making.
Building and maintaining dashboards in Metabase for monitoring key performance metrics (KPIs) across finance, sales, and marketing.
Conducting data exploration to uncover actionable insights for business strategy and renewable energy project financing.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop predictive models, automate data pipelines, and integrate new datasets.
Helping the sales and marketing teams identify customer patterns, improve conversion rates, and optimize campaign performance.
Preparing visualizations and reports to communicate insights to internal teams and external stakeholders, including lenders and investors.


Your profile


You are a student or recent graduate of a top-tier university in data science, statistics, computer science, finance, or a related field.
Proficiency in at least one programming or query language such as Python, SQL, or R; expertise in all is not required but is a bonus.
A strong foundation in statistics, probability, and machine learning concepts.
Previous experience (internships or academic projects) with data analysis, financial modeling, or credit risk is highly valued.
Knowledge of financial markets, debt instruments, or renewable energy systems is an advantage.
Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail and a drive to take ownership of tasks.
Fluency in English; German is a plus, but not required.
Passion for climate action and an eagerness to contribute to solutions that make a tangible impact.
Availability for a 3-6 month internship, starting as soon as possible.


Why us?


Work out with an Urban Sports membership.
Fast career advancement opportunities with the right performance.
Central office location in Berlin.
An international working environment; exposure to Triple-A investors.


About Us

At Cloover, our mission is to empower 1 billion people to become part of the sustainable world of tomorrow by providing hassle-free access to renewable energy at the click of a button. Join the race to achieve Net Zero and enable everyone to play a role in the energy transition.

We’re building the OS for renewable energy installers, streamlining their operations from financing to working capital management. Our platform enables providers of renewable technologies to offer embedded financing options to their customers, empowering more individuals and businesses to install solar panels, battery storage, EV charging stations, and heat pumps, transforming them into independent energy suppliers.

We aim to make sustainable financing simpler, faster, and more affordable, bringing renewable energy to every household and business.

We are on an exciting growth journey, currently operating in the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, and Germany, with plans to expand to additional European markets in the coming year.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Pricing)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (all genders) to join our "Data Science Pricing" squad in Logistics on our journey to deliver amazing experiences. Pricing is one of the most impactful levers in our business—and you’ll be shaping how it works across dozens of markets and millions of customers. In this role, you’ll tackle a wide range of pricing-related challenges—from developing intelligent pricing algorithms to advancing our experimentation techniques. You will support other Data Scientists in delivering high-quality solutions, challenge assumptions, and help raise the bar for data science practices across our teams.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll work closely with multiple cross-functional teams to build and maintain scalable, reliable machine learning services deployed globally.

If you're a skilled Data Scientist and creative problem solver who’s eager to make an impact, an international workplace awaits you in the heart of Berlin!

Our pricing systems operate at the heart of a fast-moving, global food delivery business—directly influencing customer experience and company performance.

Your mission:


Design and implement automation and experimentation algorithms for pricing, from conception to production.
Take technical ownership and uphold high quality standards within the team. Mentor junior team members.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary stakeholders and translate business needs into data science solutions.
Stay up to date with the latest research and suggest state-of-the-art models to improve customer outcomes.
Contribute to long-term strategic planning and defining a short-term roadmap to tackle complex and meaningful data problems.
Most importantly: You’re excited to build global systems affecting millions of customers, and you continuously drive for excellence.


Qualifications


Solid statistical skills—you’re confident with fundamentals and first-principles thinking in statistics and machine learning theory.
Strong engineering background—you write clean, maintainable Python code and SQL queries, following best practices for production systems.
Deep expertise in at least one relevant domain (e.g., causal inference, time series, Bayesian methods, neural networks, NLP/LLM, ranking/matching, advanced experimentation).
Thoughtful approach—you challenge assumptions and care deeply about working with clean, trustworthy data.
Substantial experience in a business environment where you developed a strong business understanding.
Clear communicator—you can distill complex requirements from many stakeholders into a clear, MVP-ready direction.
You value agile processes, data-driven development, reliability, and rigorous experimentation.


Nice to have:


Experience in pricing or food delivery business.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Retail Customer Data Platform Modernisation)




Location: Berlin (Remote-first with occasional onsite travel)

Contract Length: 6–12 months

Day Rate: €750–€900/day

Language: B2+ German

Client: Retail/E-commerce




Project Overview




We’re partnering with a market-leading retail & e-commerce company based in Berlin as they modernise their Customer Data Platform (CDP) to enable real-time customer insights, personalised experiences, and scalable AI-driven segmentation.




This is a strategic transformation initiative powered by Databricks and a modern cloud-native data stack, offering a unique opportunity to shape how customer data is modelled, activated, and optimised across the business.




The role is remote-first with occasional travel to Berlin HQ (1–2 days/month).




Key Responsibilities




Build machine learning models for real-time customer segmentation, churn prediction, and next-best-action scoring
Optimise CDP architecture
Leverage PySpark, MLflow, and Delta Lake to create clean, production-ready pipelines
Implement identity resolution and behavioural analytics using first-party and third-party data
Work closely with CRM, marketing, and digital product teams to drive personalisation use cases
Support integration of CDP with cloud-based activation platforms and marketing tools




Key Requirements




Strong experience with Databricks, PySpark, MLflow, and customer data modelling
Solid understanding of CLTV, churn, segmentation, and personalisation frameworks
Python & SQL expertise with a cloud-native mindset (Azure)
Familiarity with CDP platforms, data privacy, and marketing technology (e.g., Adobe, Salesforce, Bloomreach) is a plus
Retail experience required
Fluent German (B2+) essential
Must be based in Berlin or surrounding region




If you are interested in the Freelance Data Scientist position, please apply with an up-to-date CV as soon as possible.

Client: Retail/E-commerce


Project Overview


We’re partnering with a market-leading retail & e-commerce company based in Berlin as they modernise their Customer Data Platform (CDP) to enable real-time customer insights, personalised experiences, and scalable AI-driven segmentation.


This is a strategic transformation initiative powered by Databricks and a modern cloud-native data stack, offering a unique opportunity to shape how customer data is modelled, activated, and optimised across the business.


The role is remote-first with occasional travel to Berlin HQ (1–2 days/month).


Key Responsibilities


  • Build machine learning models for real-time customer segmentation, churn prediction, and next-best-action scoring
  • Optimise CDP architecture
  • Leverage PySpark, MLflow, and Delta Lake to create clean, production-ready pipelines
  • Implement identity resolution and behavioural analytics using first-party and third-party data
  • Work closely with CRM, marketing, and digital product teams to drive personalisation use cases
  • Support integration of CDP with cloud-based activation platforms and marketing tools


Key Requirements


  • Strong experience with Databricks, PySpark, MLflow, and customer data modelling
  • Solid understanding of CLTV, churn, segmentation, and personalisation frameworks
  • Python & SQL expertise with a cloud-native mindset (Azure)
  • Familiarity with CDP platforms, data privacy, and marketing technology (e.g., Adobe, Salesforce, Bloomreach) is a plus
  • Retail experience required
  • Fluent German (B2+) essential
  • Must be based in Berlin or surrounding region


If you are interested in the Freelance Data Scientist position, please apply with an up-to-date CV as soon as possible.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Optimization)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join the Logistics Optimization team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The Optimization Tribe's purpose is to maximize Delivery Hero's logistics performance. We achieve this by owning and continuously improving the sophisticated algorithm that solves the real-time vehicle routing problem, assigning orders efficiently every minute. This directly impacts DH's core efficiency and customer satisfaction KPIs, influencing decisions for stakeholders from Operations to Product.

As a Data Scientist, your value lies in tackling these fascinating problems head-on and building ML products which shape the algorithm's logic and decisions to meet our long-term goals of best-in-class efficiency and service, making a tangible impact across the Delivery Hero network.


Lead the conceptualization and design of advanced modeling solutions (ML, Statistics or Mathematical) to tackle complex, large-scale Logistics challenges, ensuring alignment with business value and stakeholder needs.
Take ownership of developing, implementing, and automating robust data science models and pipelines, including feature generation, retraining, and prediction deployment, leveraging tools like BigQuery and Spark as needed.
Actively drive technical discussions and problem-solving sessions, contributing significant expertise and innovative ideas to overcome the toughest modeling hurdles alongside your Data Science peers and squad lead.
Translate sophisticated analytical findings and model outcomes into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders, demonstrably driving value and improvements in key business metrics.
Proactively engage with Data & ML Engineering and Tech teams to define critical data requirements and influence technical roadmaps, ensuring the necessary data infrastructure for impactful projects.
Make a significant impact within our fast-paced, global organization by delivering high-quality solutions, sharing knowledge, and contributing to the team's overall growth and best practices.


Qualifications


You have significant experience (ideally 5+ years) designing and implementing diverse machine learning models (e.g., regression, classification, tree-based ensembles) to solve real-world business problems, backed by a strong theoretical foundation in statistics and probability.
You possess expert-level Python skills (incl. pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), proficiency in SQL, and demonstrable experience building robust, maintainable, and automated ML pipelines using Big Data technologies (e.g., BigQuery, Spark) and workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Metaflow), applying software engineering best practices.
You excel at translating ambiguous business requirements into well-defined technical problems and data science solutions, critically evaluating assumptions and ensuring data quality throughout the process.
You are a strong communicator, capable of clearly explaining complex technical concepts, model intuition, and business implications to diverse audiences (both technical and non-technical stakeholders).
You are a proactive team player with proven experience collaborating effectively with peers and cross-functional teams (like Data Engineering and Tech) in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Fluency in English is required.


Nice to have:


Deeper experience applying Operations Research techniques to solve optimization problems relevant to logistics.
Proven track record in designing, implementing, and analyzing complex experiments (beyond standard A/B tests) or applying causal inference methods.
Experience building interactive data visualizations, applications, or dashboards using libraries like Streamlit, Plotly Dash, or similar tools to communicate results effectively.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.
Show more

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description

What We're Looking For:

We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) to contribute to Data Enrichment efforts within Meltwater. As a part of this role, you will work with experienced team members and product managers to design, test, and implement machine learning solutions.

Through Meltwater's innovative social listening platform, we ensure our clients never miss any mention of their brand or essential topics across various platforms, automating the entire social listening process.

Partner with us and be part of a diverse community that values your unique contributions, empowering you to reach new heights. Join us in crafting something extraordinary.

What You’ll Do:


Contribute to the development of scalable algorithms for processing large datasets, implement and evaluate machine learning and deep learning algorithms for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and summarization.
Assist in the design, development, and testing of ML models for real-time processing of unstructured data.
Collaborate with senior team members to analyze the impact of algorithm changes.
Learn and grow under mentorship, gaining exposure to industry-standard NLP tools and techniques.


What You’ll Bring:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 2-4 years working experience OR a Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 0-2 years working experience.
Programming Language: Proficiency in Python.
Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
Proficient in Machine Learning, including understanding Neural Networks and foundational concepts of NLP tasks such as Tokenization, Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Part-of-Speech (POS) Analysis.
Experience or coursework in Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong problem-solving skills and a curiosity for learning new technologies.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure (preferable), AWS, or Google Cloud).
Basic knowledge of containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
Interest in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.
Passion for exploring the intersection of NLP and emerging fields such as generative AI or multimodal systems.


What We Offer:


Enjoy 26 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
Enjoy national and global health coverage through our statutory health insurance, ensuring your well-being wherever you are
Benefit from a 30% employer contribution to our Company Pension scheme (BAV)
Enjoy an additional day off on your birthday, promoting a healthy work-life balance
Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones because mental wellness matters.
Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.


Where You'll Work: Brückenstraße 6, 10179 Berlin

Our Story

At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right environment, great things happen.

Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around

the world to make better business decisions through data. But we can’t do that without our global team of developers, innovators, problem-solvers, and high-performers who embrace challenges and find new solutions for our customers.

Our award-winning global culture drives everything we do and creates

an environment where our employees can make an impact, learn every day, feel a sense of belonging, and celebrate each other’s successes along

the way.

We are innovators at the core who see the potential in people, ideas and technologies. Together, we challenge ourselves to go big, be bold, and build best-in-class solutions for our customers.

We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,200+ employees in 50 locations across

25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to unlock new heights in your career.

We are Meltwater. Inspired by innovation, powered by people.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.

All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.

Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.

Title: (Junior) Analytics Engineer
Description:
About Gemma Analytics

At Gemma, we help our clients activate data by using state-of-the-art technology. Our clients make better choices and are empowered to make use of their data on their own. We are service-focused, yet also build open-source tools to deliver a more effective and efficient service. You can read more about our data philosophy here.

Our clients range from Series A ventures to SMEs with 30 to 13,000 employees per client. We have an honest, pleasant, and fun work environment. Please make reference calls on us for validation :)

About The Job

Gemma Analytics helps startups and SMEs become truly data-driven.

As one of our (Junior) Analytics Engineers, you’ll play a key role in helping our clients turn raw data into meaningful business insights. Your superpower is not just understanding data – it's asking the right questions, seeing patterns others miss, and helping teams make smart, informed decisions.

You’ll work closely with clients to understand their business needs, uncover data opportunities, and build the foundations for robust, scalable analytics. In your first months, you'll be supported by experienced mentors to help you grow confidently into your role.

This role is ideal for someone with a strong business foundation who’s excited to dive deeper into the world of data.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with domain experts and business stakeholders to translate needs into data solutions
Develop clean, understandable data models and pipelines (we’re tooling-agnostic, so you’ll learn a lot!)
Build intuitive reports and dashboards that help clients track what matters
Explore and validate new tools and approaches in the modern data stack
Learn and grow alongside a supportive team of data & analytics engineers, data analysts and data consultants


Who You Are

We’re looking for someone with strong business acumen, analytical thinking, and a hunger to learn. You may have started your career in a business domain and are now eager to combine that experience with data to make an even bigger impact. You bring:


A degree in Business, Economics, or a related field — or hands-on business experience in a commercial, marketing, product, or operations role
OR a recent MBA or other advanced business training
First experience with SQL and relational databases
A curious, open mindset and the ability to think in both numbers and narratives


Bonus If You Also Have


Experience with a programming language (e.g. Python)
Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Experience managing stakeholders or cross-functional collaboration
A basic understanding of data modeling techniques (e.g. Kimball or Data Vault)
Business fluency in German and English (C1 or native level in both)
We welcome applications from all backgrounds — especially those underrepresented in tech and data. If you’re unsure whether you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We’re looking for potential, not perfection.


Gemma Perks

We are located in Berlin, close to Nordbahnhof. We are currently 20 colleagues and will grow to 22 colleagues until the end of the year. Other perks include


We have an honest, inclusive work environment and want to nurture this environment
We have frequent team events in Berlin: our cultural base
We encourage workcations and even do workcations as a company - it is up to you to come to the office between two and five days a week
We don’t compromise on equipment - a powerful Laptop, extra screens, and all the tools you need to be effective
We will surround you with great people who love to solve (mostly data) riddles
We believe in efficient working hours rather than long working hours - we focus on the output rather than the input
We learn and share during meetups, lunch & learn sessions and are open for further initiatives
We pay a market-friendly salary and we additionally distribute at least 20% of profits to our employees
We are fast-growing, have technology at our core, yet we do not rely on a VC and operate profitably
We have a great yearly offsite event that brings us all together for a full week, enjoying good food, having a good time, and of course, solving complex data-related tasks solving complex data-related tasks


How You'll Get Here


CV Screening
Phone/Coffee/Tea Conversation
Coding challenge @home
Interviews with 3 future colleagues
Reference calls
Offer + Hired


About Us

We are Gemma Analytics: a Berlin-based company specialized in generating insights in a high-performance data infrastructure. Gemma was founded in early 2020 by two data enthusiasts. Ever since we have helped over 50 companies becoming more data-driven and successful. We have a fun, honest, and inclusive work environment. We are always looking for data-minded people we can learn from.
Show more

Title: Staff Data Scientist - (Quick Commerce)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Data Scientist to join our Quick Commerce Commercial Tribe. In this role you will be exposed to various topics related to our Quick Commerce business – assortment optimisation, content generation, promotion effectiveness improvement, and ranking. You will help other Data Scientists to deliver high quality solutions, challenge our assumptions and improve DS practices across our teams.

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will work closely with multiple cross-functional teams (Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and Software Engineers) to build and maintain highly scalable and reliable ML services deployed in dozens of countries globally with millions of customers.

If you're a skilled Data Scientist and creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Guide the discovery of new innovative data products from conception to operationalization to help optimize our systems and improve the experience for our users.
Keep yourself up to date and suggest state-of-the-art models to find out what works best for our customers.
Be the main reference point for new research and tech quality of Data Science in Qcommerce Commercial & Media Solutions tribes.
Enable collaboration and knowledge sharing by pushing cross teams’ projects.
Set up our teams for success by creating a long-term vision, a mid-term strategy, and several short-term roadmaps toward some of the most complex and interesting data problems.
Last but not least, you are not afraid to build global systems that are used by thousands of people and constantly strive for excellence.


Qualifications


Strong Statistical & ML Foundation – Comfortable with fundamentals, first-principles thinking, and ML theory across various domains.
Software Engineering Best Practices – Write maintainable Python code, ensuring high standards in production systems (observability, monitoring, performance).
Domain Expertise – Deep knowledge in at least one relevant area, such as causal inference, time series, Bayesian methods, NLP/LLM, ranking/matching, or advanced experimentation.
Data-Driven Approach – Carefully question assumptions before working on use cases and prioritize clean, reliable data.
Effective Communication & Agile Mindset – Filter and prioritize stakeholder requirements, focusing on MVPs and agile development.
Mentorship & Collaboration – Support team growth through mentoring while emphasizing reliability, disciplined experimentation, and data-focused development.


Nice to Have:


Leadership & Operational Excellence – Proven leadership in driving operational excellence and best practices within engineering teams.
System Design & Scalability – Experience designing and implementing large, scalable distributed systems using microservices and heterogeneous platform components, with knowledge of GCP.
Expertise in Testing & Knowledge Sharing – Strong background in A/B testing to analyze model effectiveness, with a record of knowledge sharing through conferences or publications.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Data Scientist to join our Quick Commerce Commercial Tribe. In this role you will be exposed to various topics related to our Quick Commerce business – assortment optimisation, content generation, promotion effectiveness improvement, and ranking. You will help other Data Scientists to deliver high quality solutions, challenge our assumptions and improve DS practices across our teams.

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will work closely with multiple cross-functional teams (Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, and Software Engineers) to build and maintain highly scalable and reliable ML services deployed in dozens of countries globally with millions of customers.

If you're a skilled Data Scientist and creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

  • Guide the discovery of new innovative data products from conception to operationalization to help optimize our systems and improve the experience for our users.
  • Keep yourself up to date and suggest state-of-the-art models to find out what works best for our customers.
  • Be the main reference point for new research and tech quality of Data Science in Qcommerce Commercial & Media Solutions tribes.
  • Enable collaboration and knowledge sharing by pushing cross teams’ projects.
  • Set up our teams for success by creating a long-term vision, a mid-term strategy, and several short-term roadmaps toward some of the most complex and interesting data problems.
  • Last but not least, you are not afraid to build global systems that are used by thousands of people and constantly strive for excellence.

  • Data-Driven Approach – Carefully question assumptions before working on use cases and prioritize clean, reliable data.
  • Effective Communication & Agile Mindset – Filter and prioritize stakeholder requirements, focusing on MVPs and agile development.
  • Mentorship & Collaboration – Support team growth through mentoring while emphasizing reliability, disciplined experimentation, and data-focused development.

Nice to Have:

  • Leadership & Operational Excellence – Proven leadership in driving operational excellence and best practices within engineering teams.

  • Expertise in Testing & Knowledge Sharing – Strong background in A/B testing to analyze model effectiveness, with a record of knowledge sharing through conferences or publications.

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week

  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and Courses.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client is one of Berlin’s most exciting new AI startups — backed by top-tier investors and led by a visionary founding team with deep domain expertise. They're building intelligent systems that do more than just automate — they understand, adapt, and learn in real time. And now they’re looking for a Data Scientist to shape the next phase of their AI-driven product evolution.




As a core member of the Data Science team, you won’t just be running models — you’ll be designing end-to-end data workflows, building and evaluating state-of-the-art AI systems, and working alongside engineers and product teams to translate insights into real-world impact. This is your opportunity to work on bleeding-edge ML with purpose — in an environment where experimentation and bold ideas are part of the DNA.




What you’ll be working with:

A modern data stack: Python, SQL, and TypeScript (for integration)
Leading ML/AI frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, ONNX, HuggingFace
Scalable infrastructure: GCP, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Firestore, AlloyDB
Productionizing ML: from fine-tuning foundation models (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, LLaMA, etc.) to optimizing deployment pipelines
Cross-functional collaboration with engineers, designers, and domain experts to shape smart, adaptive AI products




What they’re looking for:

Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, and modern data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with ML model development and deployment (bonus: exposure to LLMs and generative AI)
A solid grasp of data architecture, experimentation, and performance evaluation
A collaborative mindset with a track record of working across disciplines to solve complex problems
Experience in startup or fast-paced environments is a plus




Why this role?

Autonomy & Ownership: You’ll shape how data science is done — from tools to strategy
Impact: Your models and insights will directly influence core product experiences
Real-world AI: Build systems that are used, not just published
Growth: Join at an early stage with equity, a strong mission, and rapid professional growth

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Role: Machine Learning Engineer (B2 German required)
Location: Berlin, Germany (Hybrid)
Salary: €80,000 – €100,000

About:
Our client are a fast-growing, profitable company driving AI breakthroughs for clients across industries. Their team of passionate engineers rapidly delivers AI-powered MVPs, transforming clients into AI powerhouses.

The Role:
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will:

Lead AI-driven projects, turning Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) into production-ready MVPs.
Build data pipelines, develop and deploy ML models, and integrate them into client systems.
Collaborate with corporates, NGOs, scale-ups, and public sector organizations.
What You Bring:

Software Expertise: 2+ years of experience building scalable software solutions with Python and SQL.
ML Skills: Hands-on experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn) and the full ML lifecycle (training, deployment, monitoring).
Cloud & Deployment: Experience with cloud platforms (preferably Azure), Docker, and secure web applications (SSL certificates).
Adaptability: Comfortable with ambiguity and solving diverse engineering challenges.
German Proficiency: B2 or higher for client communication (required).
Nice-to-Haves:

Experience with LLMs (OpenAI, Claude API).
Front-end development skills.
Integration with SAP.
Data science tools (pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn).
What They Offer:

Growth: A chance to do the best work of your career with continuous learning and development.
Impact: Be part of a pioneering AI company, delivering real-world breakthroughs.
Flexibility: Innovative work practices and a supportive, value-driven environment.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Python, REST, ML Ops)
Description:
At Wasteer, we’re pioneering AI-driven solutions to revolutionize waste management. Our goal is to turn waste into a resource through innovative digital platforms, empowering the shift to a circular economy. Backed by NEEW Ventures, we have the expertise and resources to make a lasting impact.




We’re looking for a passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in Berlin. If you’re excited about integrating AI/ML systems into real-world applications and delivering exceptional results, we want to hear from you.


Tasks


What you'll do





Develop and integrate AI/ML systems to optimize processes in waste management.


Manage the full lifecycle of machine learning models, from development to deployment, using ML Ops tools.


Design and maintain RESTful APIs for seamless interaction with AI systems.


Work with large datasets to create innovative, scalable solutions.


Collaborate with developers and product managers to align AI solutions with business goals.



Requirements


What we're looking for





Skills: Proficiency in Python, experience with REST APIs, and knowledge of ML Ops tools.


Mindset: A passion for leveraging AI/ML to solve complex, real-world problems.


Collaboration: A team player who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


Drive: A hunger for learning, improving, and delivering exceptional results.


Focus: A commitment to building practical, scalable systems that deliver measurable impact.





Why join us?





Impact: Contribute to sustainable solutions that redefine waste management.


Culture: Be part of an ambitious, international team in Berlin.


Collaboration First: We prioritize in-person teamwork to foster creativity and innovation.


Growth Opportunities: Shape the future of our AI/ML systems while growing your skills.
Show more

Title: Freelance AI Agent Assistant
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

If you're a professional who works with AI Data Annotation and friendly user of LLMs, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your editing, annotating, fact-checking and creative skills to an AI training project.

This is a freelance role for a project, and your typical tasks may include:


Conduct high-quality web searches to verify facts, gather supporting data, and cross-check AI responses.
Perform fact-checking and intent verification to ensure AI responses align with the user's goals.
Carefully review and flag any inaccuracies, inconsistencies, or irrelevant answers.
Provide structured feedback on AI-generated content to help improve model performance.
Work effectively with large language models (LLMs), understanding their capabilities and limitations, and applying best practices when interacting with them
Prompt generation with a purpose to receive the best quality result of LLMs



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher
You have professional and/or educational experience in data annotation, demonstrate a deeper-than-user-level interest in AI, and possess intellectual breadth and curiosity
You are skilled in web searching, fact-checking, intent-checking, able to work with LLMs and have great attention to detail
Your level of English is upper-intermediate (B2) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Logistics, Service)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Scientist (NLP) - Logistics, Service (all genders) to join our team to help us create outstanding customer service products using NLP, machine learning and generative AI.

You will join the Service Data Science squad on our mission to automate and optimize interactions with customers, making sure they have a high quality experience which scales as our business grows. We pride ourselves on our ability to connect research and theory to practical problems, and to bring our solutions to production systems. The squad is supported by an amazing team of ML Engineers who build reusable tooling, so our Data Scientists are able to focus on solving the modelling challenges. We also integrate closely with product teams so that we keep connected to the needs of the organization.

If you are a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, a diverse, international and inclusive workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:


Conceptualize the right modelling approach for challenges in the field of Customer Service at scale, together with your squad lead and our stakeholders, using cutting-edge research to inform your decisions
Build solutions end-to-end from inception to production-grade systems - including research & prototyping, gathering data requirements, cross-team alignment, product development, experimentation, deployment and monitoring.
Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.
Have fun and grow together with your team.


Qualifications


You have 5+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist in industry, or in equivalent academic roles
You have experience applying machine learning or statistical methods to real-world datasets and a proven track record of delivering data science solutions to production systems.
You are familiar with classical NLP and NLU problems, such as text classification, summarisation, translation, NER and speech-to-text.
You are familiar with libraries such as HF Transformers, SpaCY, pytorch or JAX, as well as gen-ai tooling such as llama.cpp, langchain or similar. You also understand typical Generative AI model architectures such as transformers, VAE or GANs, frameworks such as Retrieval Augmented Generation, and are familiar with finetuning methods such as LORA.
You are fluent in Python, and familiar with a range of scientific and statistical libraries. Other languages are a bonus!
You have a strong working knowledge of AB testing, and experience of designing and analysing experiments to inform the development of products
You have experience with a range of software engineering tools including Git, Docker, cloud technologies (GCP/AWS), Kubernetes, CI/CD, and pipeline tools such as Metaflow.
You write maintainable code that follows best practices in software engineering.
You are fluent in English.


Additional Information


Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.
Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.
Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

  • You have experience with a range of software engineering tools including Git, Docker, cloud technologies (GCP/AWS), Kubernetes, CI/CD, and pipeline tools such as Metaflow.
  • You write maintainable code that follows best practices in software engineering.
  • You are fluent in English.

Additional Information

  • Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.
  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.
  • Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Deine Rolle
Unterstütze Optimierungsprojekte im Handel mit analytischen Fähigkeiten 
Experimentiere mit Machine Learning Modellen für die Vorhersage von Absatz und Kosten
Kontakt mit Händlern zur Verbesserung der 7Learnings Software
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Ingenieurteam
Verbesserung unserer Pipeline und unseres Modellcodes
Unterstützung der Überwachung, Messung und Erforschung großer Datenmengen 

Das bringst du mit
Bachelor/Master in BWL, Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Mathematik, Physik oder verwandten Studien
Ein ergebnis-orientierter, pragmatischer Geist
Erste praktische Erfahrung mit maschinellem Lernen und Datenwissenschaften durch Praktika oder Werkstudententätigkeit
Erfahrung mit GIT, Tensorflow, Google Cloud, SQL oder BigQuery sind hilfreich
Deutsch: mindestens C1




Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Büro im Herzen von Berlin-Kreuzberg
Home-Office-Möglichkeit an 2–3 Tagen pro Woche
30 Urlaubstage pro Jahr
Vertrauenskultur und regelmäßiges, konstruktives Feedback
Hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung
Direkte Berichtslinie an die Gründer




Über uns

7Learnings ist eine der führenden Optimierungsplattformen für Händler. Wir bieten einen Softwareservice zur Preis- und Marketingoptimierung für Onlinehändler an. Mit Hilfe unseres Algorithmus können bis zu 10% der Ausgaben für Rabatte bei gleichbleibenden Umsätzen gespart werden. Dies wird dadurch erreicht, dass unnötige Rabatte identifiziert und eliminiert werden. Gleichzeitig werden mehr Rabatte in Produkte mit höherer Preiselastizität gelenkt. Unsere Methode ermöglicht es auch einem kleinen Team die Preise nach neuesten Erkenntnissen zu steuern und Geld zu sparen.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About ai|coustics




At ai|coustics, we’re building the quality layer for Voice AI. Our AI-powered speech technology turns any audio - live or recorded - into studio-quality output in real time. Since our launch, we’ve built a community of over 500,000 users, have processed more than 2 million audio files and signed contracts with leading audio brands like Elgato, Radio France International or Deutsche Welle.




We recently closed our 5M Seed round with leading investors like Partech and Connect Ventures alongside Inovia Capital, FOV Ventures, Intuition and Arc Investors. We’re at a pivotal moment of growth and product innovation - and we’re looking for ambitious builders to join us on this journey. If you’re excited about defining a new category in Voice AI and shaping the future of audio, we’d love to meet you.




Who we are




We’re an in-person team of audio and technology enthusiasts based out of Berlin. We love being in the office, hanging out together and learning from each other everyday.




We ship fast. All of our work is novel and cutting edge, and execution speed is paramount. Our culture thrives on autonomy, ownership, and open collaboration - where the best ideas win, no matter where they come from.




We support each other. We have an open and inclusive culture that’s focused on giving everyone the resources they need to succeed.




About the role




We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for audio, a strong track record of training and deploying models, and the drive to create real-world impact—beyond just papers and benchmarks. Join a small, focused team building the core algorithms behind our products, where you'll take full ownership of the machine learning lifecycle


Tasks



Model development & deployment: Design, train, evaluate, optimize, and deploy deep learning models for speech enhancement—and more. Our work spans both lightweight models for edge devices and high-performance models for the cloud.


Data-centric development: Build, curate, and refine training datasets and simulation pipelines. Develop robust evaluation frameworks to drive model performance.


MLOps & Tooling: Help us continuously improve our internal tools, pipelines, and infrastructure to accelerate iteration and ensure reliability.



Requirements



5+ years of hands-on experience building and iterating on custom deep learning models, ideally in a startup or product-centric environment


Strong expertise in audio and speech processing—you understand the quirks, challenges, and beauty of sound.


Experience with sequence-to-sequence and generative models.


Expert-level proficiency with PyTorch and its ecosystem.


Familiarity with cloud-based training setups, experiment tracking tools, and modern development practices. You write clean, modular, production-ready code.


A startup mindset: You're comfortable with ambiguity, take initiative, and value robust solutions over academic perfection.



Benefits



Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary package and additional benefits.


Stock Options: Early-stage employees receive stock options, enabling you to share in the company’s success.


Learning Opportunities: Collaborate with a team of accomplished audio and ML experts, with ample room for professional growth.


Startup Culture: Immerse yourself in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with passionate and collaborative colleagues.


Professional Growth: Seize the chance to shape your career path as the company expands.


High Impact: Join a groundbreaking startup at a pivotal growth stage, making a real difference in how people experience audio.


Contribute to the Future: Help define the landscape of generative audio and speech enhancement technology.





If you are ready to lead the charge in revolutionizing the audio experience and drive our startup to new heights, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join the ai-coustics team!

Show more

Title: Senior Manager, People Data Science & Insights
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Manager, People Data Science & Insights to join the People & Culture team shaping the future of data-driven decision-making at Delivery Hero.

You will play a crucial role in enabling our stakeholders to achieve business objectives by bridging the gap between data and actionable insights. You will shape our data strategy, build strong stakeholder relationships, and drive analytics excellence. You will lead a team of up to 7 fostering a culture of excellence, impact and innovation. Your leadership will ensure data quality and accuracy, adhering to best practices and governance principles. Your role will involve managing stakeholder relationships, prioritizing initiatives and projects, and driving team development. Your work will directly empower business decisions globally and contribute to our strategic objectives.

Join the team that champions the employee experience at Delivery Hero. As part of the People & Culture Team, you’ll help attract, develop, and retain top talent, creating a workplace where people feel valued, supported, and empowered to grow. With each initiative you support, you’ll be building a positive culture that fuels innovation, teamwork, and a sense of belonging across our global organization.


Lead a team of data professionals, fostering collaboration, continuous improvement and growth
Guide the team to own the analysis cycle, from gathering the business requirements, framing the question, building hypotheses, running the analysis, presenting insights and recommending meaningful actions to senior stakeholders
Share Data (Science) best practices and enable the team to select appropriate methodologies / techniques to analyse data and extract insight for key stakeholders in an efficient and secure way
Drive the development and delivery of impactful data engineering, insights and analytics products.
Manage prioritization and resource allocation to maximize value delivery.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field).
A minimum of 8+ years of experience in data science/ analytics, with at least 5+ years in a leadership role managing data teams.
Proven leadership ability in managing diverse, high-performing teams and in developing and executing strategic plans to meet business objectives.
Proficient in the full data analysis lifecycle, including problem formulation, data quality, auditing, rigorous analysis, interpretation, and presentation.
Deep knowledge of Big Data technologies, preferably with experience in BigQuery and the Google Cloud Platform, as well as with classical machine learning frameworks.
Exceptional collaboration, relationship building and communication skills, capable of guiding, influencing, and persuading a wide range of stakeholders.
Ability to understand business needs, align data science efforts to companies OKRs.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Platform Engineer

Location - Berlin (Remote first)

Salary - 95k-125k




Our client is a VC backed B2B SaaS company, on a mission to transform how organizations manage risk and compliance, using cutting-edge technology and AI to automate and enhance governance workflows. Backed by strong funding and led by a proven team, they’re building a platform that redefines how businesses handle compliance in a digital-first world.




They’re now seeking a talented and driven AI Engineer to join their team and take the lead on the design and implementation of intelligent systems that drive automation, efficiency, and insight across the platform. The ideal candidate will combine strong software engineering skills with a passion for building practical AI solutions in real-world environments.




Key Responsibilities

Technical Leadership: Take ownership of end-to-end design and development of AI-powered features, ensuring performance, observability, and scalability from the outset.
Intelligent Systems Development: Build and refine agent-like systems, integrating with vector search and document retrieval frameworks to support dynamic, user-driven workflows.
Hands-On Architecture: Lead on the architecture, lifecycle, and deployment of AI features, from prototyping through to production and beyond.
Collaboration: Work closely with Product, Engineering, and Design teams to translate requirements into robust, efficient AI features that directly enhance user experience.
Operational Excellence: Champion quality, security, and reliability throughout the AI stack, ensuring all systems comply with internal InfoSec and data privacy requirements.
Tooling & Innovation: Contribute to the internal toolset that supports AI development velocity and stay abreast of advances in LLMs, vector databases, and agent frameworks — bringing practical ideas into the product.
Best Practices: Drive performance optimization, cost control, robust fallback strategies, and strong test coverage in AI feature design.




Tech Environment

Languages & Frameworks: Python (core AI), TypeScript, LangChain, LlamaIndex
Infrastructure & DevOps: AWS, Azure OpenAI, Terraform, Temporal
Data & Search: pgvector, semantic search libraries
Application Layer: NodeJS, GraphQL, monorepo setup




Ideal Candidate Profile

AI Application Expertise: Strong experience designing and deploying AI/LLM-based features in production, ideally in high-compliance or data-sensitive industries.
Deep Technical Acumen: Skilled in RAG pipelines, vector search integration, prompt engineering, and constructing advanced LLM-driven workflows.
Well-Rounded Engineer: Strong background in both backend development and AI/ML integration, with fluency in Python and TypeScript.
Quality-Focused: Brings rigor to engineering through TDD, CI/CD, detailed documentation, and clean architecture.
Cross-Functional Communicator: Able to explain complex systems to non-technical stakeholders and align technical execution with product goals.
Mentorship & Growth: Ideally brings experience mentoring others and contributing to the technical direction of teams or projects.
